flawed_nl_solution:
Sol will sell 10 + 4 = <<10+4=14>>14 candies on the second day.
She will sell 14 + 4 = <<14+4=18>>18 candies on the third day.
She will sell 18 + 4 = <<18+4=22>>22 candies on the fourth day.
She will sell 22 + 4 = <<22+4=31>>31 candies on the fifth day.
She will sell 31 + 4 = <<31+4=35>>35 candies on the sixth day.
She will sell a total of 10 + 14 + 18 + 22 + 31 + 35 = <<10+14+18+22+31+35=130>>130 candies in a week.
Hence, she will earn 130 x 10 = <<130*10=1300>>1300 cents.
Since 1 dollar is equal to 100 cents, then Sol will earn 1300/100 = $<<1300/100=13>>13
#### 13

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 26, not 31. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
